heisig_chinese_memo: Sayeth"?! Who the hell says "sayeth"? Doesn't seem quite right...just like this hanzi, which is just like "day" but doesn't seem "quite right.".
heisig_story: Pent in . . . one. The key word refers to famous sayings of famous people, and is the origin for the primitive meaning of a tongue wagging in the mouth that we learned in frame 12. The size of this kanji, a relatively rare one, is what distinguishes it from day.

humanum_full_description_en:
The oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions of the word " yue " are from the " mouth " from a short horizontal line, which means that there is something above the mouth, and the short horizontal line is like the sound of the mouth. The original meaning is "speech" or "words" spoken by mouth. The exegesis of "Shuowen" is exactly: "Yes, words are also. From the mouth, the second sound, it is also like the tone. All the belongings of the saying are from the saying." Duan Yucai's note: "The person who said, the meaning is said. It is also outside. There is meaning and there is speech, which is also called the word, and it is also called the cloud." "The Sound and Meaning of the Book of Filial Piety" says: From Yi is in the mouth. Yi is like the air, the person will speak, and the mouth will have air." The shape and structure of " yue " are similar to "ä»Š" and " yan ", because "ä»Š" means " one " under "äº¼" (inverted mouth), and " yan " means " one " above " tongue ". See "ä»Š", "è¨€".

Oracle stated that "Collection" 586: "Wang Yue". It also means that it is called, which is equivalent to "Wei Zhi", "Compilation" 14295: "The East is called " Analysis ", and the wind is called "åŠ¦." It means that the eastern name is "Ana" and the wind there is called "åŠ¦".

Jin Wen also said that the Great Ding Ding: "Wang Ruo said," that is, Zhou Wang said so. It also means that it is called "Zhang Ding": "Shou ğ¢†¶(å…¹) five [fu]: accompany, constancy, accompany [è€’è€’], â–¡, province." It means to receive five slaves: the name is accompany, the name is Heng, his name is [è€’è€’], his name is â–¡, his name is Sheng. It is also used as a modal particle at the beginning of a sentence, in the history wall plate: "Yue Guwen Wang". "Shang Shu. "Yao Dian": "Said Ruo Ji Gu."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period said, "Guodian Jane. Jane 45 of "Bao Yi": "Song people also (have) said." "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Parents of the People" Jane 3: "Confucius Says." It is also called, "Guodian Jane. Lao Zi Jia Jian 34: "Wisdom (knowledge) and Ming," which means that the principle of knowing and harmony is called " Ming ". "Tsinghua Jane II. Jane 31: "Jin Xiangong's concubine (å¬–) is called Liji", which means that the concubine that Jin Xiangong favors is named Liji.

The oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions of the word " yue" are from the " mouth" from a short horizontal line, which means that there is something above the mouth, and the short horizontal line is like the sound of the mouth. The original meaning is "speech" or "words" spoken by mouth. The exegesis of "Shuowen" is exactly: "Yes, words are also. From the mouth, the second sound, it is also like the tone. All the belongings of the saying are from the saying." Duan Yucai's note: "The person who said, the meaning is said. It is also outside. There is meaning and there is speech, which is also called the word, and it is also called the cloud." "The Sound and Meaning of the Book of Filial Piety" says: From Yi is in the mouth. Yi is like the air, the person will speak, and the mouth will have air." The shape and structure of " yue" are similar to " ä»Š" and " yan", because " ä»Š" means " one" under " äº¼" (inverted mouth), and " yan" means " one" above " tongue". See " ä»Š", " è¨€". It means that the eastern name is "Ana" and the wind there is called " åŠ¦". Jin Wen also said that the Great Ding Ding: "Wang Ruo said," that is, Zhou Wang said so.
